|Intitle=Clinical iconography of a typical example of a vesicular eruption of the concha in favour of zoster PFP

See the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available

question.question: Which of the following is a typical clinical presentation of Ramsay Hunt syndrome?
question.option_a: A vesicular eruption on the concha of the ear
question.option_b: A rash on the palms and soles of the feet
question.option_c: A painful, blistering rash around the eyes and nose
question.option_d: A generalized skin rash with fever
